TEXAS RESIDENTS - Please REPOST and take five minutes for an important follow up to my previous message regarding how you can help increase pay for Direct Service Providers working with, among others, children and adults with IDD (intellectual and developmental disabilities): The House subcommittee is meeting Tuesday and Wednesday OF THIS WEEK to consider testimony about the need for increased wages for our direct care staff. You can provide online support through the legislative portal at the following link: https://lnkd.in/gn-nswsZSHOULD YOU CHOOSE TO SUBMIT YOUR SUPPORT, YOUR COMMENTS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY WEDNESDAY FEB. 26th.INSTRUCTIONS: After clicking the link above, you will first have to verify you are a Texas resident and fill in your name, address and phone number. Next, scroll to the section labeled "Appropriations - S/C on Article II February 26, 2025 - 8:00 AM [E1.030]" and then to the subtitle labeled "Article II Special Provisions".  Click SELECT.  Then you can enter your message.  If you choose, a sample message you can cut and paste is below.  After that click submit.  Thank you in advance for taking the time to help!!SAMPLE MESSAGE: The State Supported Living Centers and the State Hospitals experienced severe manpower shortages and turnover. On January 24, 2023 the Texas Health & Human Service Commission announced an increase in Direct Support Professionals (DSP) starting wages to $17.50 per hour as authorized by the 88th Legislature in Article II, Rider 95. In its August 2024 Report required by Rider 95, Health Human Services reported to the Legislature that as a result of the compensation change, filled positions have increased dramatically from 15,460 in February 2022 to 18,331 in April 2024 and turnover has declined from 40.70% to 25.84% in the same timeframe. DSP Filled Positions have increased from 3,964 in September 2022 to 5,006 in May 2024, an increase of 26.30% Private Provider DSP’s have the same task responsibilities as the SSLC and SH DSP’s. Funding DSP pay at the same level will increase filled positions, reduce turnover, and, MOST IMPORTANTLY, dramatically improve quality of care and client outcomes. I encourage you to provide for a starting wage of $17.50 per hour to properly compensate those who care for the Special Needs Population and restore the unfilled positions in our DSP Workforce. It will not only improve the quality of care but have a positive economic impact on our DSPs and our State Economy.

We're hashtag#Hiring: QA Leader – PET - Job title: QA Leader – PET Company: GE HealthCare Job description: Job Description Summary As a member of the PET QA team, the QA Leader supports the maintenance and improvement of quality standards in the PET Global Supply Chain by working with third party manufacturers to ensure continuous manufacturing capability for GEHC products and then monitoring their performance via reviews and audits. The job holder will also represent QA in supply chain projects.GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.Job DescriptionEssential Responsibilities Managing the quality relationship through set up and continuous oversight of multiple third party manufacturing sites to achieve consistent product quality and compliance to applicable regulatory requirements Conducting reviews, performing audits, clearly documenting findings and identifying risk across the PET Global Supply Chain Clearly communicating audit results and recommendations Providing follow up activities to internal and external audits including: identifying root cause, assessing risk and providing direction on potential resolution. Supporting routine internal QA operating mechanisms to ensure compliance and continuous improvement of the supply chain and quality management system Supporting activities related to product registrations and regulatory processes Representing QA on technology transfer and product / process improvement projects Qualifications /RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a Scientific, Engineering, Computer Science, core Life Science discipline, or a combination of training and experience demonstrating the equivalent * 3+ years of Quality Assurance/Regulatory Assurance experience in the pharmaceutical industry; Supervisory/management experience Desired Characteristics Certified Auditor or Lead Auditor Experience working in remote teams and with people in different countries Knowledge and experience of the manufacture of radiopharmaceuticals and /or medical devices Experience hosting and /or responding to regulatory GMP or ISO inspections Strong track record of identifying and fixing compliance issues Strong process improvement mindset, passion for quality We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership –always with unyielding integrity.Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. South Seattle radio station KVRU 105.7 FM has a new owner and operator: Media for Informed Communities, headed by Crystal Fincher and Monisha Harrell. Fincher and Harrell are taking the reins from Seattle arts organization Southeast Effective Development (SEED) and SEEDArts. A low-power radio station dedicated to local music, culture, politics, and sports, KVRU also hosted community workshops and media classes. “We see ourselves as a part of this community and a hub for connection,” said Fincher, a former KVRU programmer. “I think connection is something we are sorely lacking. We’ve lost so many spaces and have gotten away from connecting with each other in real life. I think the station’s ability to do that is really important.”Read the full article by Jas Keimig today at South Seattle Emerald. https://lnkd.in/gQFPpkwE ///hashtag#SouthSeattleEmerald hashtag#Seattle hashtag#SouthSeattle hashtag#SouthEnd hashtag#KVRU

The Epoch Times ◼️ US ◼️ Regional & State News ◼️ State News ◼️ Ohio News Vivek Ramaswamy Announces Candidacy for Ohio Governor****************************************************************The Ohio-born biotech entrepreneur, who still lives in the state, launched his bid a month after leaving DOGE.****************************************************************By Jeff Louderback2/24/2025; Updated: 2/24/2025CINCINNATI—Vivek Ramaswamy, the Cincinnati-born biotech entrepreneur who ran for president last year before leaving the race and supporting President Donald Trump, has launched a bid for Ohio governor.His announcement on Feb. 24 had been anticipated for several weeks since the 39-year-old Ramaswamy left his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on the first day of Trump’s new term.The Ohio native, who now lives in suburban Columbus, kicked off his candidacy at CTL Aerospace amid a crowd holding “Vivek for Ohio” signs. Many attendees wore pro-Trump and pro-DOGE apparel.Born to Indian parents, Ramaswamy earned degrees at Harvard University and Yale Law School before he gained success as an investment partner for hedge fund QVT Financial, founded Roivant Sciences, and co-founded his own investment firm, Strive Asset Management.He first rose to national prominence with his 2021 book “Woke Inc: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam.”During his presidential campaign, Ramaswamy outlined 10 core beliefs, led by “God is real,” followed by “there are two genders,” in his 2024 book ”Truths: The Future of America First.”Ramaswamy has vowed to be a pro-business governor and referenced how, in the early 1900s, Ohio boasted some of the wealthiest cities in the country because of industry.He said Ohio will lead the nation’s second industrial revolution in the “sectors of the future.”Ramaswamy also vowed to “break down income tax to zero.”“It is your money, not the government’s,” he said.Ramaswamy also said that he will drive down property taxes.“It’s your land, not a lease from the government,” he said.*****Ramaswamy joins a Republican gubernatorial primary field that includes Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost and southern Ohio entrepreneur Heather Hill.*****In social media posts, Trump has encouraged Ramaswamy to run for Ohio governor. Ohio Republicans State Treasurer Robert Sprague and Secretary of State Frank LaRose have endorsed Ramaswamy.Jack Phillips contributed to this report.Jeff LouderbackReporterJeff Louderback covers news and features on the White House and executive agencies for The Epoch Times. He also reports on Senate and House elections. A professional journalist since 1990, Jeff has a versatile background that includes covering news and politics, business, professional and college sports, and lifestyle topics for regional and national media outlets.▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ♻️  Repost: ➕ me for 🌷 Daily Inspirations and Tidd Bits. ➤ Bernie Tidd on LinkedIn.

TEXAS RESIDENTS - Please REPOST and take five minutes for an important follow up to my previous message regarding how you can help increase pay for Direct Service Providers working with, among others, children and adults with IDD (intellectual and developmental disabilities): The House subcommittee is meeting Tuesday and Wednesday OF THIS WEEK to consider testimony about the need for increased wages for our direct care staff. You can provide online support through the legislative portal at the following link: https://lnkd.in/gn-nswsZSHOULD YOU CHOOSE TO SUBMIT YOUR SUPPORT, YOUR COMMENTS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY WEDNESDAY FEB. 26th.INSTRUCTIONS: After clicking the link above, you will first have to verify you are a Texas resident and fill in your name, address and phone number. Next, scroll to the section labeled "Appropriations - S/C on Article II February 26, 2025 - 8:00 AM [E1.030]" and then to the subtitle labeled "Article II Special Provisions".  Click SELECT.  Then you can enter your message.  If you choose, a sample message you can cut and paste is below.  After that click submit.  Thank you in advance for taking the time to help!!SAMPLE MESSAGE: The State Supported Living Centers and the State Hospitals experienced severe manpower shortages and turnover. On January 24, 2023 the Texas Health & Human Service Commission announced an increase in Direct Support Professionals (DSP) starting wages to $17.50 per hour as authorized by the 88th Legislature in Article II, Rider 95. In its August 2024 Report required by Rider 95, Health Human Services reported to the Legislature that as a result of the compensation change, filled positions have increased dramatically from 15,460 in February 2022 to 18,331 in April 2024 and turnover has declined from 40.70% to 25.84% in the same timeframe. DSP Filled Positions have increased from 3,964 in September 2022 to 5,006 in May 2024, an increase of 26.30% Private Provider DSP’s have the same task responsibilities as the SSLC and SH DSP’s. Funding DSP pay at the same level will increase filled positions, reduce turnover, and, MOST IMPORTANTLY, dramatically improve quality of care and client outcomes. I encourage you to provide for a starting wage of $17.50 per hour to properly compensate those who care for the Special Needs Population and restore the unfilled positions in our DSP Workforce. It will not only improve the quality of care but have a positive economic impact on our DSPs and our State Economy.

South Seattle radio station KVRU 105.7 FM has a new owner and operator: Media for Informed Communities, headed by Crystal Fincher and Monisha Harrell. Fincher and Harrell are taking the reins from Seattle arts organization Southeast Effective Development (SEED) and SEEDArts. A low-power radio station dedicated to local music, culture, politics, and sports, KVRU also hosted community workshops and media classes. “We see ourselves as a part of this community and a hub for connection,” said Fincher, a former KVRU programmer. “I think connection is something we are sorely lacking. We’ve lost so many spaces and have gotten away from connecting with each other in real life. I think the station’s ability to do that is really important.”Read the full article by Jas Keimig today at South Seattle Emerald. https://lnkd.in/gQFPpkwE ///hashtag#SouthSeattleEmerald hashtag#Seattle hashtag#SouthSeattle hashtag#SouthEnd hashtag#KVRU

The Epoch Times ◼️ US ◼️ Regional & State News ◼️ State News ◼️ Ohio News Vivek Ramaswamy Announces Candidacy for Ohio Governor****************************************************************The Ohio-born biotech entrepreneur, who still lives in the state, launched his bid a month after leaving DOGE.****************************************************************By Jeff Louderback2/24/2025; Updated: 2/24/2025CINCINNATI—Vivek Ramaswamy, the Cincinnati-born biotech entrepreneur who ran for president last year before leaving the race and supporting President Donald Trump, has launched a bid for Ohio governor.His announcement on Feb. 24 had been anticipated for several weeks since the 39-year-old Ramaswamy left his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on the first day of Trump’s new term.The Ohio native, who now lives in suburban Columbus, kicked off his candidacy at CTL Aerospace amid a crowd holding “Vivek for Ohio” signs. Many attendees wore pro-Trump and pro-DOGE apparel.Born to Indian parents, Ramaswamy earned degrees at Harvard University and Yale Law School before he gained success as an investment partner for hedge fund QVT Financial, founded Roivant Sciences, and co-founded his own investment firm, Strive Asset Management.He first rose to national prominence with his 2021 book “Woke Inc: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam.”During his presidential campaign, Ramaswamy outlined 10 core beliefs, led by “God is real,” followed by “there are two genders,” in his 2024 book ”Truths: The Future of America First.”Ramaswamy has vowed to be a pro-business governor and referenced how, in the early 1900s, Ohio boasted some of the wealthiest cities in the country because of industry.He said Ohio will lead the nation’s second industrial revolution in the “sectors of the future.”Ramaswamy also vowed to “break down income tax to zero.”“It is your money, not the government’s,” he said.Ramaswamy also said that he will drive down property taxes.“It’s your land, not a lease from the government,” he said.*****Ramaswamy joins a Republican gubernatorial primary field that includes Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost and southern Ohio entrepreneur Heather Hill.*****In social media posts, Trump has encouraged Ramaswamy to run for Ohio governor. Ohio Republicans State Treasurer Robert Sprague and Secretary of State Frank LaRose have endorsed Ramaswamy.Jack Phillips contributed to this report.Jeff LouderbackReporterJeff Louderback covers news and features on the White House and executive agencies for The Epoch Times. He also reports on Senate and House elections. A professional journalist since 1990, Jeff has a versatile background that includes covering news and politics, business, professional and college sports, and lifestyle topics for regional and national media outlets.▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ♻️  Repost: ➕ me for 🌷 Daily Inspirations and Tidd Bits. ➤ Bernie Tidd on LinkedIn.

TEXAS RESIDENTS - Please REPOST and take five minutes for an important follow up to my previous message regarding how you can help increase pay for Direct Service Providers working with, among others, children and adults with IDD (intellectual and developmental disabilities): The House subcommittee is meeting Tuesday and Wednesday OF THIS WEEK to consider testimony about the need for increased wages for our direct care staff. You can provide online support through the legislative portal at the following link: https://lnkd.in/gn-nswsZSHOULD YOU CHOOSE TO SUBMIT YOUR SUPPORT, YOUR COMMENTS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY WEDNESDAY FEB. 26th.INSTRUCTIONS: After clicking the link above, you will first have to verify you are a Texas resident and fill in your name, address and phone number. Next, scroll to the section labeled "Appropriations - S/C on Article II February 26, 2025 - 8:00 AM [E1.030]" and then to the subtitle labeled "Article II Special Provisions".  Click SELECT.  Then you can enter your message.  If you choose, a sample message you can cut and paste is below.  After that click submit.  Thank you in advance for taking the time to help!!SAMPLE MESSAGE: The State Supported Living Centers and the State Hospitals experienced severe manpower shortages and turnover. On January 24, 2023 the Texas Health & Human Service Commission announced an increase in Direct Support Professionals (DSP) starting wages to $17.50 per hour as authorized by the 88th Legislature in Article II, Rider 95. In its August 2024 Report required by Rider 95, Health Human Services reported to the Legislature that as a result of the compensation change, filled positions have increased dramatically from 15,460 in February 2022 to 18,331 in April 2024 and turnover has declined from 40.70% to 25.84% in the same timeframe. DSP Filled Positions have increased from 3,964 in September 2022 to 5,006 in May 2024, an increase of 26.30% Private Provider DSP’s have the same task responsibilities as the SSLC and SH DSP’s. Funding DSP pay at the same level will increase filled positions, reduce turnover, and, MOST IMPORTANTLY, dramatically improve quality of care and client outcomes. I encourage you to provide for a starting wage of $17.50 per hour to properly compensate those who care for the Special Needs Population and restore the unfilled positions in our DSP Workforce. It will not only improve the quality of care but have a positive economic impact on our DSPs and our State Economy.

South Seattle radio station KVRU 105.7 FM has a new owner and operator: Media for Informed Communities, headed by Crystal Fincher and Monisha Harrell. Fincher and Harrell are taking the reins from Seattle arts organization Southeast Effective Development (SEED) and SEEDArts. A low-power radio station dedicated to local music, culture, politics, and sports, KVRU also hosted community workshops and media classes. “We see ourselves as a part of this community and a hub for connection,” said Fincher, a former KVRU programmer. “I think connection is something we are sorely lacking. We’ve lost so many spaces and have gotten away from connecting with each other in real life. I think the station’s ability to do that is really important.”Read the full article by Jas Keimig today at South Seattle Emerald. https://lnkd.in/gQFPpkwE ///hashtag#SouthSeattleEmerald hashtag#Seattle hashtag#SouthSeattle hashtag#SouthEnd hashtag#KVRU

The Epoch Times ◼️ US ◼️ Regional & State News ◼️ State News ◼️ Ohio News Vivek Ramaswamy Announces Candidacy for Ohio Governor****************************************************************The Ohio-born biotech entrepreneur, who still lives in the state, launched his bid a month after leaving DOGE.****************************************************************By Jeff Louderback2/24/2025; Updated: 2/24/2025CINCINNATI—Vivek Ramaswamy, the Cincinnati-born biotech entrepreneur who ran for president last year before leaving the race and supporting President Donald Trump, has launched a bid for Ohio governor.His announcement on Feb. 24 had been anticipated for several weeks since the 39-year-old Ramaswamy left his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on the first day of Trump’s new term.The Ohio native, who now lives in suburban Columbus, kicked off his candidacy at CTL Aerospace amid a crowd holding “Vivek for Ohio” signs. Many attendees wore pro-Trump and pro-DOGE apparel.Born to Indian parents, Ramaswamy earned degrees at Harvard University and Yale Law School before he gained success as an investment partner for hedge fund QVT Financial, founded Roivant Sciences, and co-founded his own investment firm, Strive Asset Management.He first rose to national prominence with his 2021 book “Woke Inc: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam.”During his presidential campaign, Ramaswamy outlined 10 core beliefs, led by “God is real,” followed by “there are two genders,” in his 2024 book ”Truths: The Future of America First.”Ramaswamy has vowed to be a pro-business governor and referenced how, in the early 1900s, Ohio boasted some of the wealthiest cities in the country because of industry.He said Ohio will lead the nation’s second industrial revolution in the “sectors of the future.”Ramaswamy also vowed to “break down income tax to zero.”“It is your money, not the government’s,” he said.Ramaswamy also said that he will drive down property taxes.“It’s your land, not a lease from the government,” he said.*****Ramaswamy joins a Republican gubernatorial primary field that includes Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost and southern Ohio entrepreneur Heather Hill.*****In social media posts, Trump has encouraged Ramaswamy to run for Ohio governor. Ohio Republicans State Treasurer Robert Sprague and Secretary of State Frank LaRose have endorsed Ramaswamy.Jack Phillips contributed to this report.Jeff LouderbackReporterJeff Louderback covers news and features on the White House and executive agencies for The Epoch Times. He also reports on Senate and House elections. A professional journalist since 1990, Jeff has a versatile background that includes covering news and politics, business, professional and college sports, and lifestyle topics for regional and national media outlets.▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ♻️  Repost: ➕ me for 🌷 Daily Inspirations and Tidd Bits. ➤ Bernie Tidd on LinkedIn.

DSP Filled Positions have increased from 3,964 in September 2022 to 5,006 in May 2024, an increase of 26.30% Private Provider DSP’s have the same task responsibilities as the SSLC and SH DSP’s. Funding DSP pay at the same level will increase filled positions, reduce turnover, and, MOST IMPORTANTLY, dramatically improve quality of care and client outcomes. I encourage you to provide for a starting wage of $17.50 per hour to properly compensate those who care for the Special Needs Population and restore the unfilled positions in our DSP Workforce. It will not only improve the quality of care but have a positive economic impact on our DSPs and our State Economy.

We're hashtag#Hiring: QA Leader – PET - Job title: QA Leader – PET Company: GE HealthCare Job description: Job Description Summary As a member of the PET QA team, the QA Leader supports the maintenance and improvement of quality standards in the PET Global Supply Chain by working with third party manufacturers to ensure continuous manufacturing capability for GEHC products and then monitoring their performance via reviews and audits. The job holder will also represent QA in supply chain projects.GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.Job DescriptionEssential Responsibilities Managing the quality relationship through set up and continuous oversight of multiple third party manufacturing sites to achieve consistent product quality and compliance to applicable regulatory requirements Conducting reviews, performing audits, clearly documenting findings and identifying risk across the PET Global Supply Chain Clearly communicating audit results and recommendations Providing follow up activities to internal and external audits including: identifying root cause, assessing risk and providing direction on potential resolution. Supporting routine internal QA operating mechanisms to ensure compliance and continuous improvement of the supply chain and quality management system Supporting activities related to product registrations and regulatory processes Representing QA on technology transfer and product / process improvement projects Qualifications /RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a Scientific, Engineering, Computer Science, core Life Science discipline, or a combination of training and experience demonstrating the equivalent * 3+ years of Quality Assurance/Regulatory Assurance experience in the pharmaceutical industry; Supervisory/management experience Desired Characteristics Certified Auditor or Lead Auditor Experience working in remote teams and with people in different countries Knowledge and experience of the manufacture of radiopharmaceuticals and /or medical devices Experience hosting and /or responding to regulatory GMP or ISO inspections Strong track record of identifying and fixing compliance issues Strong process improvement mindset, passion for quality We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership –always with unyielding integrity.Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. South Seattle radio station KVRU 105.7 FM has a new owner and operator: Media for Informed Communities, headed by Crystal Fincher and Monisha Harrell. We’ve lost so many spaces and have gotten away from connecting with each other in real life. The Epoch Times ◼️ US ◼️ Regional & State News ◼️ State News ◼️ Ohio News Vivek Ramaswamy Announces Candidacy for Ohio Governor****************************************************************The Ohio-born biotech entrepreneur, who still lives in the state, launched his bid a month after leaving DOGE.****************************************************************By Jeff Louderback2/24/2025; Updated: 2/24/2025CINCINNATI—Vivek Ramaswamy, the Cincinnati-born biotech entrepreneur who ran for president last year before leaving the race and supporting President Donald Trump, has launched a bid for Ohio governor.His announcement on Feb. 24 had been anticipated for several weeks since the 39-year-old Ramaswamy left his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on the first day of Trump’s new term.The Ohio native, who now lives in suburban Columbus, kicked off his candidacy at CTL Aerospace amid a crowd holding “Vivek for Ohio” signs. Many attendees wore pro-Trump and pro-DOGE apparel.Born to Indian parents, Ramaswamy earned degrees at Harvard University and Yale Law School before he gained success as an investment partner for hedge fund QVT Financial, founded Roivant Sciences, and co-founded his own investment firm, Strive Asset Management.He first rose to national prominence with his 2021 book “Woke Inc: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam.”During his presidential campaign, Ramaswamy outlined 10 core beliefs, led by “God is real,” followed by “there are two genders,” in his 2024 book ”Truths: The Future of America First.”Ramaswamy has vowed to be a pro-business governor and referenced how, in the early 1900s, Ohio boasted some of the wealthiest cities in the country because of industry.He said Ohio will lead the nation’s second industrial revolution in the “sectors of the future.”Ramaswamy also vowed to “break down income tax to zero.”“It is your money, not the government’s,” he said.Ramaswamy also said that he will drive down property taxes.“It’s your land, not a lease from the government,” he said.*****Ramaswamy joins a Republican gubernatorial primary field that includes Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost and southern Ohio entrepreneur Heather Hill.*****In social media posts, Trump has encouraged Ramaswamy to run for Ohio governor. Ohio Republicans State Treasurer Robert Sprague and Secretary of State Frank LaRose have endorsed Ramaswamy.Jack Phillips contributed to this report.Jeff LouderbackReporterJeff Louderback covers news and features on the White House and executive agencies for The Epoch Times. He also reports on Senate and House elections. A professional journalist since 1990, Jeff has a versatile background that includes covering news and politics, business, professional and college sports, and lifestyle topics for regional and national media outlets.▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ♻️  Repost: ➕ me for 🌷 Daily Inspirations and Tidd Bits. ➤ Bernie Tidd on LinkedIn.

TEXAS RESIDENTS - Please REPOST and take five minutes for an important follow up to my previous message regarding how you can help increase pay for Direct Service Providers working with, among others, children and adults with IDD (intellectual and developmental disabilities): The House subcommittee is meeting Tuesday and Wednesday OF THIS WEEK to consider testimony about the need for increased wages for our direct care staff. You can provide online support through the legislative portal at the following link: https://lnkd.in/gn-nswsZSHOULD YOU CHOOSE TO SUBMIT YOUR SUPPORT, YOUR COMMENTS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY WEDNESDAY FEB. 26th.INSTRUCTIONS: After clicking the link above, you will first have to verify you are a Texas resident and fill in your name, address and phone number. Next, scroll to the section labeled "Appropriations - S/C on Article II February 26, 2025 - 8:00 AM [E1.030]" and then to the subtitle labeled "Article II Special Provisions".  Click SELECT.  Then you can enter your message.  If you choose, a sample message you can cut and paste is below.  After that click submit.  Thank you in advance for taking the time to help!!SAMPLE MESSAGE: The State Supported Living Centers and the State Hospitals experienced severe manpower shortages and turnover. On January 24, 2023 the Texas Health & Human Service Commission announced an increase in Direct Support Professionals (DSP) starting wages to $17.50 per hour as authorized by the 88th Legislature in Article II, Rider 95. In its August 2024 Report required by Rider 95, Health Human Services reported to the Legislature that as a result of the compensation change, filled positions have increased dramatically from 15,460 in February 2022 to 18,331 in April 2024 and turnover has declined from 40.70% to 25.84% in the same timeframe. DSP Filled Positions have increased from 3,964 in September 2022 to 5,006 in May 2024, an increase of 26.30% Private Provider DSP’s have the same task responsibilities as the SSLC and SH DSP’s. Funding DSP pay at the same level will increase filled positions, reduce turnover, and, MOST IMPORTANTLY, dramatically improve quality of care and client outcomes. I encourage you to provide for a starting wage of $17.50 per hour to properly compensate those who care for the Special Needs Population and restore the unfilled positions in our DSP Workforce. It will not only improve the quality of care but have a positive economic impact on our DSPs and our State Economy.

Supporting routine internal QA operating mechanisms to ensure compliance and continuous improvement of the supply chain and quality management system Supporting activities related to product registrations and regulatory processes Representing QA on technology transfer and product / process improvement projects Qualifications /RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a Scientific, Engineering, Computer Science, core Life Science discipline, or a combination of training and experience demonstrating the equivalent * 3+ years of Quality Assurance/Regulatory Assurance experience in the pharmaceutical industry; Supervisory/management experience Desired Characteristics Certified Auditor or Lead Auditor Experience working in remote teams and with people in different countries Knowledge and experience of the manufacture of radiopharmaceuticals and /or medical devices Experience hosting and /or responding to regulatory GMP or ISO inspections Strong track record of identifying and fixing compliance issues Strong process improvement mindset, passion for quality We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership –always with unyielding integrity.Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. South Seattle radio station KVRU 105.7 FM has a new owner and operator: Media for Informed Communities, headed by Crystal Fincher and Monisha Harrell. Username: Comox Valley Regional DistrictComox Valley Regional District
Post Content:
CVRD News: Unified Alternative Approval Process Results AnnouncedThe Comox Valley Regional District (CVRD) Unified Alternative Approval Process (AAP) has completed and results have been finalized. The deadline for responses was February 18, 2025 at 4:30pm.Less than 10% of the eligible electors signed and submitted elector response forms by the deadline for all four CVRD initiatives.In line with provincial legislation, the Corporate Officer has reviewed and certified the results. Elector response forms must be rejected when:- an elector signed more than one form (duplicates);- an elector is determined to be ineligible;- more than one non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to the same property; or - a non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to a property owned in whole or in part by a corporation.In this instance, the vast majority of rejected elector response forms were either due to duplicate forms submitted or ineligibility, as residents were outside of the defined service area.These results and the associated bylaws will be considered by the CVRD Board at their February 25, 2025 regular meeting.Full news release: https://ow.ly/7HrW50V5NXZFor more information on the AAP and to learn more about voter requirements for each initiative, visit www.comoxvalleyrd.ca/aap.

The Epoch Times ◼️ US ◼️ Regional & State News ◼️ State News ◼️ Ohio News Vivek Ramaswamy Announces Candidacy for Ohio Governor****************************************************************The Ohio-born biotech entrepreneur, who still lives in the state, launched his bid a month after leaving DOGE.****************************************************************By Jeff Louderback2/24/2025; Updated: 2/24/2025CINCINNATI—Vivek Ramaswamy, the Cincinnati-born biotech entrepreneur who ran for president last year before leaving the race and supporting President Donald Trump, has launched a bid for Ohio governor.His announcement on Feb. 24 had been anticipated for several weeks since the 39-year-old Ramaswamy left his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on the first day of Trump’s new term.The Ohio native, who now lives in suburban Columbus, kicked off his candidacy at CTL Aerospace amid a crowd holding “Vivek for Ohio” signs. Many attendees wore pro-Trump and pro-DOGE apparel.Born to Indian parents, Ramaswamy earned degrees at Harvard University and Yale Law School before he gained success as an investment partner for hedge fund QVT Financial, founded Roivant Sciences, and co-founded his own investment firm, Strive Asset Management.He first rose to national prominence with his 2021 book “Woke Inc: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam.”During his presidential campaign, Ramaswamy outlined 10 core beliefs, led by “God is real,” followed by “there are two genders,” in his 2024 book ”Truths: The Future of America First.”Ramaswamy has vowed to be a pro-business governor and referenced how, in the early 1900s, Ohio boasted some of the wealthiest cities in the country because of industry.He said Ohio will lead the nation’s second industrial revolution in the “sectors of the future.”Ramaswamy also vowed to “break down income tax to zero.”“It is your money, not the government’s,” he said.Ramaswamy also said that he will drive down property taxes.“It’s your land, not a lease from the government,” he said.*****Ramaswamy joins a Republican gubernatorial primary field that includes Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost and southern Ohio entrepreneur Heather Hill.*****In social media posts, Trump has encouraged Ramaswamy to run for Ohio governor. Ohio Republicans State Treasurer Robert Sprague and Secretary of State Frank LaRose have endorsed Ramaswamy.Jack Phillips contributed to this report.Jeff LouderbackReporterJeff Louderback covers news and features on the White House and executive agencies for The Epoch Times. He also reports on Senate and House elections. A professional journalist since 1990, Jeff has a versatile background that includes covering news and politics, business, professional and college sports, and lifestyle topics for regional and national media outlets.▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ♻️  Repost: ➕ me for 🌷 Daily Inspirations and Tidd Bits. ➤ Bernie Tidd on LinkedIn.

TEXAS RESIDENTS - Please REPOST and take five minutes for an important follow up to my previous message regarding how you can help increase pay for Direct Service Providers working with, among others, children and adults with IDD (intellectual and developmental disabilities): The House subcommittee is meeting Tuesday and Wednesday OF THIS WEEK to consider testimony about the need for increased wages for our direct care staff. You can provide online support through the legislative portal at the following link: https://lnkd.in/gn-nswsZSHOULD YOU CHOOSE TO SUBMIT YOUR SUPPORT, YOUR COMMENTS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY WEDNESDAY FEB. 26th.INSTRUCTIONS: After clicking the link above, you will first have to verify you are a Texas resident and fill in your name, address and phone number. Next, scroll to the section labeled "Appropriations - S/C on Article II February 26, 2025 - 8:00 AM [E1.030]" and then to the subtitle labeled "Article II Special Provisions".  Click SELECT.  Then you can enter your message.  If you choose, a sample message you can cut and paste is below.  After that click submit.  Thank you in advance for taking the time to help!!SAMPLE MESSAGE: The State Supported Living Centers and the State Hospitals experienced severe manpower shortages and turnover. On January 24, 2023 the Texas Health & Human Service Commission announced an increase in Direct Support Professionals (DSP) starting wages to $17.50 per hour as authorized by the 88th Legislature in Article II, Rider 95. In its August 2024 Report required by Rider 95, Health Human Services reported to the Legislature that as a result of the compensation change, filled positions have increased dramatically from 15,460 in February 2022 to 18,331 in April 2024 and turnover has declined from 40.70% to 25.84% in the same timeframe. DSP Filled Positions have increased from 3,964 in September 2022 to 5,006 in May 2024, an increase of 26.30% Private Provider DSP’s have the same task responsibilities as the SSLC and SH DSP’s. Funding DSP pay at the same level will increase filled positions, reduce turnover, and, MOST IMPORTANTLY, dramatically improve quality of care and client outcomes. I encourage you to provide for a starting wage of $17.50 per hour to properly compensate those who care for the Special Needs Population and restore the unfilled positions in our DSP Workforce. It will not only improve the quality of care but have a positive economic impact on our DSPs and our State Economy.

Most people don’t realize this resource exists—but it could be a game-changer.If you run a church, shelter, school, or community event, you can call 2-1-1, and they will send outreach staff directly to your location to connect people with vital services—eliminating transportation barriers.I spoke with Jeanette Curtis, director of Fairfield County’s 2-1-1, about how they’re making it easier for people to access the help they need. Too often, resources exist, but people don’t know how to find them. This service bridges that gap.If you work in social services, education, faith-based organizations, or community outreach, this is something you should know about. Let’s get the word out!Watch the full interview on The Resource Podcast and let’s start a conversation in the comments. The job holder will also represent QA in supply chain projects.GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.Job DescriptionEssential Responsibilities Managing the quality relationship through set up and continuous oversight of multiple third party manufacturing sites to achieve consistent product quality and compliance to applicable regulatory requirements Conducting reviews, performing audits, clearly documenting findings and identifying risk across the PET Global Supply Chain Clearly communicating audit results and recommendations Providing follow up activities to internal and external audits including: identifying root cause, assessing risk and providing direction on potential resolution. Supporting routine internal QA operating mechanisms to ensure compliance and continuous improvement of the supply chain and quality management system Supporting activities related to product registrations and regulatory processes Representing QA on technology transfer and product / process improvement projects Qualifications /RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a Scientific, Engineering, Computer Science, core Life Science discipline, or a combination of training and experience demonstrating the equivalent * 3+ years of Quality Assurance/Regulatory Assurance experience in the pharmaceutical industry; Supervisory/management experience Desired Characteristics Certified Auditor or Lead Auditor Experience working in remote teams and with people in different countries Knowledge and experience of the manufacture of radiopharmaceuticals and /or medical devices Experience hosting and /or responding to regulatory GMP or ISO inspections Strong track record of identifying and fixing compliance issues Strong process improvement mindset, passion for quality We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership –always with unyielding integrity.Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. South Seattle radio station KVRU 105.7 FM has a new owner and operator: Media for Informed Communities, headed by Crystal Fincher and Monisha Harrell. Fincher and Harrell are taking the reins from Seattle arts organization Southeast Effective Development (SEED) and SEEDArts. A low-power radio station dedicated to local music, culture, politics, and sports, KVRU also hosted community workshops and media classes. “We see ourselves as a part of this community and a hub for connection,” said Fincher, a former KVRU programmer. “I think connection is something we are sorely lacking. We’ve lost so many spaces and have gotten away from connecting with each other in real life. I think the station’s ability to do that is really important.”Read the full article by Jas Keimig today at South Seattle Emerald. https://lnkd.in/gQFPpkwE ///hashtag#SouthSeattleEmerald hashtag#Seattle hashtag#SouthSeattle hashtag#SouthEnd hashtag#KVRU

Post Content:
CVRD News: Unified Alternative Approval Process Results AnnouncedThe Comox Valley Regional District (CVRD) Unified Alternative Approval Process (AAP) has completed and results have been finalized. The deadline for responses was February 18, 2025 at 4:30pm.Less than 10% of the eligible electors signed and submitted elector response forms by the deadline for all four CVRD initiatives.In line with provincial legislation, the Corporate Officer has reviewed and certified the results. Elector response forms must be rejected when:- an elector signed more than one form (duplicates);- an elector is determined to be ineligible;- more than one non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to the same property; or - a non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to a property owned in whole or in part by a corporation.In this instance, the vast majority of rejected elector response forms were either due to duplicate forms submitted or ineligibility, as residents were outside of the defined service area.These results and the associated bylaws will be considered by the CVRD Board at their February 25, 2025 regular meeting.Full news release: https://ow.ly/7HrW50V5NXZFor more information on the AAP and to learn more about voter requirements for each initiative, visit www.comoxvalleyrd.ca/aap.

The Epoch Times ◼️ US ◼️ Regional & State News ◼️ State News ◼️ Ohio News Vivek Ramaswamy Announces Candidacy for Ohio Governor****************************************************************The Ohio-born biotech entrepreneur, who still lives in the state, launched his bid a month after leaving DOGE.****************************************************************By Jeff Louderback2/24/2025; Updated: 2/24/2025CINCINNATI—Vivek Ramaswamy, the Cincinnati-born biotech entrepreneur who ran for president last year before leaving the race and supporting President Donald Trump, has launched a bid for Ohio governor.His announcement on Feb. 24 had been anticipated for several weeks since the 39-year-old Ramaswamy left his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on the first day of Trump’s new term.The Ohio native, who now lives in suburban Columbus, kicked off his candidacy at CTL Aerospace amid a crowd holding “Vivek for Ohio” signs. Many attendees wore pro-Trump and pro-DOGE apparel.Born to Indian parents, Ramaswamy earned degrees at Harvard University and Yale Law School before he gained success as an investment partner for hedge fund QVT Financial, founded Roivant Sciences, and co-founded his own investment firm, Strive Asset Management.He first rose to national prominence with his 2021 book “Woke Inc: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam.”During his presidential campaign, Ramaswamy outlined 10 core beliefs, led by “God is real,” followed by “there are two genders,” in his 2024 book ”Truths: The Future of America First.”Ramaswamy has vowed to be a pro-business governor and referenced how, in the early 1900s, Ohio boasted some of the wealthiest cities in the country because of industry.He said Ohio will lead the nation’s second industrial revolution in the “sectors of the future.”Ramaswamy also vowed to “break down income tax to zero.”“It is your money, not the government’s,” he said.Ramaswamy also said that he will drive down property taxes.“It’s your land, not a lease from the government,” he said.*****Ramaswamy joins a Republican gubernatorial primary field that includes Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost and southern Ohio entrepreneur Heather Hill.*****In social media posts, Trump has encouraged Ramaswamy to run for Ohio governor. Ohio Republicans State Treasurer Robert Sprague and Secretary of State Frank LaRose have endorsed Ramaswamy.Jack Phillips contributed to this report.Jeff LouderbackReporterJeff Louderback covers news and features on the White House and executive agencies for The Epoch Times. He also reports on Senate and House elections. A professional journalist since 1990, Jeff has a versatile background that includes covering news and politics, business, professional and college sports, and lifestyle topics for regional and national media outlets.▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ♻️  Repost: ➕ me for 🌷 Daily Inspirations and Tidd Bits. ➤ Bernie Tidd on LinkedIn.

TEXAS RESIDENTS - Please REPOST and take five minutes for an important follow up to my previous message regarding how you can help increase pay for Direct Service Providers working with, among others, children and adults with IDD (intellectual and developmental disabilities): The House subcommittee is meeting Tuesday and Wednesday OF THIS WEEK to consider testimony about the need for increased wages for our direct care staff. You can provide online support through the legislative portal at the following link: https://lnkd.in/gn-nswsZSHOULD YOU CHOOSE TO SUBMIT YOUR SUPPORT, YOUR COMMENTS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY WEDNESDAY FEB. 26th.INSTRUCTIONS: After clicking the link above, you will first have to verify you are a Texas resident and fill in your name, address and phone number. Next, scroll to the section labeled "Appropriations - S/C on Article II February 26, 2025 - 8:00 AM [E1.030]" and then to the subtitle labeled "Article II Special Provisions".  Click SELECT.  Then you can enter your message.  If you choose, a sample message you can cut and paste is below.  After that click submit.  Thank you in advance for taking the time to help!!SAMPLE MESSAGE: The State Supported Living Centers and the State Hospitals experienced severe manpower shortages and turnover. On January 24, 2023 the Texas Health & Human Service Commission announced an increase in Direct Support Professionals (DSP) starting wages to $17.50 per hour as authorized by the 88th Legislature in Article II, Rider 95. In its August 2024 Report required by Rider 95, Health Human Services reported to the Legislature that as a result of the compensation change, filled positions have increased dramatically from 15,460 in February 2022 to 18,331 in April 2024 and turnover has declined from 40.70% to 25.84% in the same timeframe. DSP Filled Positions have increased from 3,964 in September 2022 to 5,006 in May 2024, an increase of 26.30% Private Provider DSP’s have the same task responsibilities as the SSLC and SH DSP’s. Funding DSP pay at the same level will increase filled positions, reduce turnover, and, MOST IMPORTANTLY, dramatically improve quality of care and client outcomes. I encourage you to provide for a starting wage of $17.50 per hour to properly compensate those who care for the Special Needs Population and restore the unfilled positions in our DSP Workforce. It will not only improve the quality of care but have a positive economic impact on our DSPs and our State Economy.

Most people don’t realize this resource exists—but it could be a game-changer.If you run a church, shelter, school, or community event, you can call 2-1-1, and they will send outreach staff directly to your location to connect people with vital services—eliminating transportation barriers.I spoke with Jeanette Curtis, director of Fairfield County’s 2-1-1, about how they’re making it easier for people to access the help they need. Too often, resources exist, but people don’t know how to find them. This service bridges that gap.If you work in social services, education, faith-based organizations, or community outreach, this is something you should know about. We're hashtag#Hiring: QA Leader – PET - Job title: QA Leader – PET Company: GE HealthCare Job description: Job Description Summary As a member of the PET QA team, the QA Leader supports the maintenance and improvement of quality standards in the PET Global Supply Chain by working with third party manufacturers to ensure continuous manufacturing capability for GEHC products and then monitoring their performance via reviews and audits. The job holder will also represent QA in supply chain projects.GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.Job DescriptionEssential Responsibilities Managing the quality relationship through set up and continuous oversight of multiple third party manufacturing sites to achieve consistent product quality and compliance to applicable regulatory requirements Conducting reviews, performing audits, clearly documenting findings and identifying risk across the PET Global Supply Chain Clearly communicating audit results and recommendations Providing follow up activities to internal and external audits including: identifying root cause, assessing risk and providing direction on potential resolution. Supporting routine internal QA operating mechanisms to ensure compliance and continuous improvement of the supply chain and quality management system Supporting activities related to product registrations and regulatory processes Representing QA on technology transfer and product / process improvement projects Qualifications /RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a Scientific, Engineering, Computer Science, core Life Science discipline, or a combination of training and experience demonstrating the equivalent * 3+ years of Quality Assurance/Regulatory Assurance experience in the pharmaceutical industry; Supervisory/management experience Desired Characteristics Certified Auditor or Lead Auditor Experience working in remote teams and with people in different countries Knowledge and experience of the manufacture of radiopharmaceuticals and /or medical devices Experience hosting and /or responding to regulatory GMP or ISO inspections Strong track record of identifying and fixing compliance issues Strong process improvement mindset, passion for quality We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership –always with unyielding integrity.Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. CVRD News: Unified Alternative Approval Process Results AnnouncedThe Comox Valley Regional District (CVRD) Unified Alternative Approval Process (AAP) has completed and results have been finalized. The deadline for responses was February 18, 2025 at 4:30pm.Less than 10% of the eligible electors signed and submitted elector response forms by the deadline for all four CVRD initiatives.In line with provincial legislation, the Corporate Officer has reviewed and certified the results. Elector response forms must be rejected when:- an elector signed more than one form (duplicates);- an elector is determined to be ineligible;- more than one non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to the same property; or - a non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to a property owned in whole or in part by a corporation.In this instance, the vast majority of rejected elector response forms were either due to duplicate forms submitted or ineligibility, as residents were outside of the defined service area.These results and the associated bylaws will be considered by the CVRD Board at their February 25, 2025 regular meeting.Full news release: https://ow.ly/7HrW50V5NXZFor more information on the AAP and to learn more about voter requirements for each initiative, visit www.comoxvalleyrd.ca/aap.

The Epoch Times ◼️ US ◼️ Regional & State News ◼️ State News ◼️ Ohio News Vivek Ramaswamy Announces Candidacy for Ohio Governor****************************************************************The Ohio-born biotech entrepreneur, who still lives in the state, launched his bid a month after leaving DOGE.****************************************************************By Jeff Louderback2/24/2025; Updated: 2/24/2025CINCINNATI—Vivek Ramaswamy, the Cincinnati-born biotech entrepreneur who ran for president last year before leaving the race and supporting President Donald Trump, has launched a bid for Ohio governor.His announcement on Feb. 24 had been anticipated for several weeks since the 39-year-old Ramaswamy left his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on the first day of Trump’s new term.The Ohio native, who now lives in suburban Columbus, kicked off his candidacy at CTL Aerospace amid a crowd holding “Vivek for Ohio” signs. Many attendees wore pro-Trump and pro-DOGE apparel.Born to Indian parents, Ramaswamy earned degrees at Harvard University and Yale Law School before he gained success as an investment partner for hedge fund QVT Financial, founded Roivant Sciences, and co-founded his own investment firm, Strive Asset Management.He first rose to national prominence with his 2021 book “Woke Inc: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam.”During his presidential campaign, Ramaswamy outlined 10 core beliefs, led by “God is real,” followed by “there are two genders,” in his 2024 book ”Truths: The Future of America First.”Ramaswamy has vowed to be a pro-business governor and referenced how, in the early 1900s, Ohio boasted some of the wealthiest cities in the country because of industry.He said Ohio will lead the nation’s second industrial revolution in the “sectors of the future.”Ramaswamy also vowed to “break down income tax to zero.”“It is your money, not the government’s,” he said.Ramaswamy also said that he will drive down property taxes.“It’s your land, not a lease from the government,” he said.*****Ramaswamy joins a Republican gubernatorial primary field that includes Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost and southern Ohio entrepreneur Heather Hill.*****In social media posts, Trump has encouraged Ramaswamy to run for Ohio governor. Ohio Republicans State Treasurer Robert Sprague and Secretary of State Frank LaRose have endorsed Ramaswamy.Jack Phillips contributed to this report.Jeff LouderbackReporterJeff Louderback covers news and features on the White House and executive agencies for The Epoch Times. He also reports on Senate and House elections. A professional journalist since 1990, Jeff has a versatile background that includes covering news and politics, business, professional and college sports, and lifestyle topics for regional and national media outlets.▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ♻️  Repost: ➕ me for 🌷 Daily Inspirations and Tidd Bits. ➤ Bernie Tidd on LinkedIn.

TEXAS RESIDENTS - Please REPOST and take five minutes for an important follow up to my previous message regarding how you can help increase pay for Direct Service Providers working with, among others, children and adults with IDD (intellectual and developmental disabilities): The House subcommittee is meeting Tuesday and Wednesday OF THIS WEEK to consider testimony about the need for increased wages for our direct care staff. You can provide online support through the legislative portal at the following link: https://lnkd.in/gn-nswsZSHOULD YOU CHOOSE TO SUBMIT YOUR SUPPORT, YOUR COMMENTS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY WEDNESDAY FEB. 26th.INSTRUCTIONS: After clicking the link above, you will first have to verify you are a Texas resident and fill in your name, address and phone number. Next, scroll to the section labeled "Appropriations - S/C on Article II February 26, 2025 - 8:00 AM [E1.030]" and then to the subtitle labeled "Article II Special Provisions".  Click SELECT.  Then you can enter your message.  If you choose, a sample message you can cut and paste is below.  After that click submit.  Thank you in advance for taking the time to help!!SAMPLE MESSAGE: The State Supported Living Centers and the State Hospitals experienced severe manpower shortages and turnover. On January 24, 2023 the Texas Health & Human Service Commission announced an increase in Direct Support Professionals (DSP) starting wages to $17.50 per hour as authorized by the 88th Legislature in Article II, Rider 95. In its August 2024 Report required by Rider 95, Health Human Services reported to the Legislature that as a result of the compensation change, filled positions have increased dramatically from 15,460 in February 2022 to 18,331 in April 2024 and turnover has declined from 40.70% to 25.84% in the same timeframe. DSP Filled Positions have increased from 3,964 in September 2022 to 5,006 in May 2024, an increase of 26.30% Private Provider DSP’s have the same task responsibilities as the SSLC and SH DSP’s. Funding DSP pay at the same level will increase filled positions, reduce turnover, and, MOST IMPORTANTLY, dramatically improve quality of care and client outcomes. I encourage you to provide for a starting wage of $17.50 per hour to properly compensate those who care for the Special Needs Population and restore the unfilled positions in our DSP Workforce. It will not only improve the quality of care but have a positive economic impact on our DSPs and our State Economy.

Most people don’t realize this resource exists—but it could be a game-changer.If you run a church, shelter, school, or community event, you can call 2-1-1, and they will send outreach staff directly to your location to connect people with vital services—eliminating transportation barriers.I spoke with Jeanette Curtis, director of Fairfield County’s 2-1-1, about how they’re making it easier for people to access the help they need. Too often, resources exist, but people don’t know how to find them. This service bridges that gap.If you work in social services, education, faith-based organizations, or community outreach, this is something you should know about. Let’s get the word out!Watch the full interview on The Resource Podcast and let’s start a conversation in the comments. The job holder will also represent QA in supply chain projects.GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.Job DescriptionEssential Responsibilities Managing the quality relationship through set up and continuous oversight of multiple third party manufacturing sites to achieve consistent product quality and compliance to applicable regulatory requirements Conducting reviews, performing audits, clearly documenting findings and identifying risk across the PET Global Supply Chain Clearly communicating audit results and recommendations Providing follow up activities to internal and external audits including: identifying root cause, assessing risk and providing direction on potential resolution. Supporting routine internal QA operating mechanisms to ensure compliance and continuous improvement of the supply chain and quality management system Supporting activities related to product registrations and regulatory processes Representing QA on technology transfer and product / process improvement projects Qualifications /RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a Scientific, Engineering, Computer Science, core Life Science discipline, or a combination of training and experience demonstrating the equivalent * 3+ years of Quality Assurance/Regulatory Assurance experience in the pharmaceutical industry; Supervisory/management experience Desired Characteristics Certified Auditor or Lead Auditor Experience working in remote teams and with people in different countries Knowledge and experience of the manufacture of radiopharmaceuticals and /or medical devices Experience hosting and /or responding to regulatory GMP or ISO inspections Strong track record of identifying and fixing compliance issues Strong process improvement mindset, passion for quality We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership –always with unyielding integrity.Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. South Seattle radio station KVRU 105.7 FM has a new owner and operator: Media for Informed Communities, headed by Crystal Fincher and Monisha Harrell. Fincher and Harrell are taking the reins from Seattle arts organization Southeast Effective Development (SEED) and SEEDArts. A low-power radio station dedicated to local music, culture, politics, and sports, KVRU also hosted community workshops and media classes. “We see ourselves as a part of this community and a hub for connection,” said Fincher, a former KVRU programmer. “I think connection is something we are sorely lacking. We’ve lost so many spaces and have gotten away from connecting with each other in real life. I think the station’s ability to do that is really important.”Read the full article by Jas Keimig today at South Seattle Emerald. https://lnkd.in/gQFPpkwE ///hashtag#SouthSeattleEmerald hashtag#Seattle hashtag#SouthSeattle hashtag#SouthEnd hashtag#KVRU

Post Content:
CVRD News: Unified Alternative Approval Process Results AnnouncedThe Comox Valley Regional District (CVRD) Unified Alternative Approval Process (AAP) has completed and results have been finalized. The deadline for responses was February 18, 2025 at 4:30pm.Less than 10% of the eligible electors signed and submitted elector response forms by the deadline for all four CVRD initiatives.In line with provincial legislation, the Corporate Officer has reviewed and certified the results. Elector response forms must be rejected when:- an elector signed more than one form (duplicates);- an elector is determined to be ineligible;- more than one non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to the same property; or - a non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to a property owned in whole or in part by a corporation.In this instance, the vast majority of rejected elector response forms were either due to duplicate forms submitted or ineligibility, as residents were outside of the defined service area.These results and the associated bylaws will be considered by the CVRD Board at their February 25, 2025 regular meeting.Full news release: https://ow.ly/7HrW50V5NXZFor more information on the AAP and to learn more about voter requirements for each initiative, visit www.comoxvalleyrd.ca/aap.

The Epoch Times ◼️ US ◼️ Regional & State News ◼️ State News ◼️ Ohio News Vivek Ramaswamy Announces Candidacy for Ohio Governor****************************************************************The Ohio-born biotech entrepreneur, who still lives in the state, launched his bid a month after leaving DOGE.****************************************************************By Jeff Louderback2/24/2025; Updated: 2/24/2025CINCINNATI—Vivek Ramaswamy, the Cincinnati-born biotech entrepreneur who ran for president last year before leaving the race and supporting President Donald Trump, has launched a bid for Ohio governor.His announcement on Feb. 24 had been anticipated for several weeks since the 39-year-old Ramaswamy left his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on the first day of Trump’s new term.The Ohio native, who now lives in suburban Columbus, kicked off his candidacy at CTL Aerospace amid a crowd holding “Vivek for Ohio” signs. Many attendees wore pro-Trump and pro-DOGE apparel.Born to Indian parents, Ramaswamy earned degrees at Harvard University and Yale Law School before he gained success as an investment partner for hedge fund QVT Financial, founded Roivant Sciences, and co-founded his own investment firm, Strive Asset Management.He first rose to national prominence with his 2021 book “Woke Inc: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam.”During his presidential campaign, Ramaswamy outlined 10 core beliefs, led by “God is real,” followed by “there are two genders,” in his 2024 book ”Truths: The Future of America First.”Ramaswamy has vowed to be a pro-business governor and referenced how, in the early 1900s, Ohio boasted some of the wealthiest cities in the country because of industry.He said Ohio will lead the nation’s second industrial revolution in the “sectors of the future.”Ramaswamy also vowed to “break down income tax to zero.”“It is your money, not the government’s,” he said.Ramaswamy also said that he will drive down property taxes.“It’s your land, not a lease from the government,” he said.*****Ramaswamy joins a Republican gubernatorial primary field that includes Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost and southern Ohio entrepreneur Heather Hill.*****In social media posts, Trump has encouraged Ramaswamy to run for Ohio governor. Ohio Republicans State Treasurer Robert Sprague and Secretary of State Frank LaRose have endorsed Ramaswamy.Jack Phillips contributed to this report.Jeff LouderbackReporterJeff Louderback covers news and features on the White House and executive agencies for The Epoch Times. He also reports on Senate and House elections. A professional journalist since 1990, Jeff has a versatile background that includes covering news and politics, business, professional and college sports, and lifestyle topics for regional and national media outlets.▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ♻️  Repost: ➕ me for 🌷 Daily Inspirations and Tidd Bits. ➤ Bernie Tidd on LinkedIn.

TEXAS RESIDENTS - Please REPOST and take five minutes for an important follow up to my previous message regarding how you can help increase pay for Direct Service Providers working with, among others, children and adults with IDD (intellectual and developmental disabilities): The House subcommittee is meeting Tuesday and Wednesday OF THIS WEEK to consider testimony about the need for increased wages for our direct care staff. You can provide online support through the legislative portal at the following link: https://lnkd.in/gn-nswsZSHOULD YOU CHOOSE TO SUBMIT YOUR SUPPORT, YOUR COMMENTS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY WEDNESDAY FEB. 26th.INSTRUCTIONS: After clicking the link above, you will first have to verify you are a Texas resident and fill in your name, address and phone number. Next, scroll to the section labeled "Appropriations - S/C on Article II February 26, 2025 - 8:00 AM [E1.030]" and then to the subtitle labeled "Article II Special Provisions".  Click SELECT.  Then you can enter your message.  If you choose, a sample message you can cut and paste is below.  After that click submit.  Thank you in advance for taking the time to help!!SAMPLE MESSAGE: The State Supported Living Centers and the State Hospitals experienced severe manpower shortages and turnover. On January 24, 2023 the Texas Health & Human Service Commission announced an increase in Direct Support Professionals (DSP) starting wages to $17.50 per hour as authorized by the 88th Legislature in Article II, Rider 95. In its August 2024 Report required by Rider 95, Health Human Services reported to the Legislature that as a result of the compensation change, filled positions have increased dramatically from 15,460 in February 2022 to 18,331 in April 2024 and turnover has declined from 40.70% to 25.84% in the same timeframe. DSP Filled Positions have increased from 3,964 in September 2022 to 5,006 in May 2024, an increase of 26.30% Private Provider DSP’s have the same task responsibilities as the SSLC and SH DSP’s. Funding DSP pay at the same level will increase filled positions, reduce turnover, and, MOST IMPORTANTLY, dramatically improve quality of care and client outcomes. I encourage you to provide for a starting wage of $17.50 per hour to properly compensate those who care for the Special Needs Population and restore the unfilled positions in our DSP Workforce. It will not only improve the quality of care but have a positive economic impact on our DSPs and our State Economy.

Most people don’t realize this resource exists—but it could be a game-changer.If you run a church, shelter, school, or community event, you can call 2-1-1, and they will send outreach staff directly to your location to connect people with vital services—eliminating transportation barriers.I spoke with Jeanette Curtis, director of Fairfield County’s 2-1-1, about how they’re making it easier for people to access the help they need. Too often, resources exist, but people don’t know how to find them. This service bridges that gap.If you work in social services, education, faith-based organizations, or community outreach, this is something you should know about. Let’s get the word out!Watch the full interview on The Resource Podcast and let’s start a conversation in the comments. The job holder will also represent QA in supply chain projects.GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.Job DescriptionEssential Responsibilities Managing the quality relationship through set up and continuous oversight of multiple third party manufacturing sites to achieve consistent product quality and compliance to applicable regulatory requirements Conducting reviews, performing audits, clearly documenting findings and identifying risk across the PET Global Supply Chain Clearly communicating audit results and recommendations Providing follow up activities to internal and external audits including: identifying root cause, assessing risk and providing direction on potential resolution. Supporting routine internal QA operating mechanisms to ensure compliance and continuous improvement of the supply chain and quality management system Supporting activities related to product registrations and regulatory processes Representing QA on technology transfer and product / process improvement projects Qualifications /RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a Scientific, Engineering, Computer Science, core Life Science discipline, or a combination of training and experience demonstrating the equivalent * 3+ years of Quality Assurance/Regulatory Assurance experience in the pharmaceutical industry; Supervisory/management experience Desired Characteristics Certified Auditor or Lead Auditor Experience working in remote teams and with people in different countries Knowledge and experience of the manufacture of radiopharmaceuticals and /or medical devices Experience hosting and /or responding to regulatory GMP or ISO inspections Strong track record of identifying and fixing compliance issues Strong process improvement mindset, passion for quality We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership –always with unyielding integrity.Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. South Seattle radio station KVRU 105.7 FM has a new owner and operator: Media for Informed Communities, headed by Crystal Fincher and Monisha Harrell. Fincher and Harrell are taking the reins from Seattle arts organization Southeast Effective Development (SEED) and SEEDArts. A low-power radio station dedicated to local music, culture, politics, and sports, KVRU also hosted community workshops and media classes. “We see ourselves as a part of this community and a hub for connection,” said Fincher, a former KVRU programmer. “I think connection is something we are sorely lacking. We’ve lost so many spaces and have gotten away from connecting with each other in real life. Username: Comox Valley Regional DistrictComox Valley Regional District
Post Content:
CVRD News: Unified Alternative Approval Process Results AnnouncedThe Comox Valley Regional District (CVRD) Unified Alternative Approval Process (AAP) has completed and results have been finalized. The deadline for responses was February 18, 2025 at 4:30pm.Less than 10% of the eligible electors signed and submitted elector response forms by the deadline for all four CVRD initiatives.In line with provincial legislation, the Corporate Officer has reviewed and certified the results. Elector response forms must be rejected when:- an elector signed more than one form (duplicates);- an elector is determined to be ineligible;- more than one non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to the same property; or - a non-resident property elector signed a form in relation to a property owned in whole or in part by a corporation.In this instance, the vast majority of rejected elector response forms were either due to duplicate forms submitted or ineligibility, as residents were outside of the defined service area.These results and the associated bylaws will be considered by the CVRD Board at their February 25, 2025 regular meeting.Full news release: https://ow.ly/7HrW50V5NXZFor more information on the AAP and to learn more about voter requirements for each initiative, visit www.comoxvalleyrd.ca/aap.

The Epoch Times ◼️ US ◼️ Regional & State News ◼️ State News ◼️ Ohio News Vivek Ramaswamy Announces Candidacy for Ohio Governor****************************************************************The Ohio-born biotech entrepreneur, who still lives in the state, launched his bid a month after leaving DOGE.****************************************************************By Jeff Louderback2/24/2025; Updated: 2/24/2025CINCINNATI—Vivek Ramaswamy, the Cincinnati-born biotech entrepreneur who ran for president last year before leaving the race and supporting President Donald Trump, has launched a bid for Ohio governor.His announcement on Feb. 24 had been anticipated for several weeks since the 39-year-old Ramaswamy left his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) on the first day of Trump’s new term.The Ohio native, who now lives in suburban Columbus, kicked off his candidacy at CTL Aerospace amid a crowd holding “Vivek for Ohio” signs. Many attendees wore pro-Trump and pro-DOGE apparel.Born to Indian parents, Ramaswamy earned degrees at Harvard University and Yale Law School before he gained success as an investment partner for hedge fund QVT Financial, founded Roivant Sciences, and co-founded his own investment firm, Strive Asset Management.He first rose to national prominence with his 2021 book “Woke Inc: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam.”During his presidential campaign, Ramaswamy outlined 10 core beliefs, led by “God is real,” followed by “there are two genders,” in his 2024 book ”Truths: The Future of America First.”Ramaswamy has vowed to be a pro-business governor and referenced how, in the early 1900s, Ohio boasted some of the wealthiest cities in the country because of industry.He said Ohio will lead the nation’s second industrial revolution in the “sectors of the future.”Ramaswamy also vowed to “break down income tax to zero.”“It is your money, not the government’s,” he said.Ramaswamy also said that he will drive down property taxes.“It’s your land, not a lease from the government,” he said.*****Ramaswamy joins a Republican gubernatorial primary field that includes Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost and southern Ohio entrepreneur Heather Hill.*****In social media posts, Trump has encouraged Ramaswamy to run for Ohio governor. Ohio Republicans State Treasurer Robert Sprague and Secretary of State Frank LaRose have endorsed Ramaswamy.Jack Phillips contributed to this report.Jeff LouderbackReporterJeff Louderback covers news and features on the White House and executive agencies for The Epoch Times. He also reports on Senate and House elections. A professional journalist since 1990, Jeff has a versatile background that includes covering news and politics, business, professional and college sports, and lifestyle topics for regional and national media outlets.▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ▪️ ♻️  Repost: ➕ me for 🌷 Daily Inspirations and Tidd Bits. ➤ Bernie Tidd on LinkedIn.
